src: Tüm notalara doğru şekilde basmaya devam ederken elinizin mümkün olduğu kadar rahat olduğundan emin olun - aynı zamanda parmaklarınızla fazladan hareketler yapmamaya çalışın. Bu şekilde kendinizi olabildiğince az yormuş olacaksınız. Unutmayın ki piyanoda olduğu gibi daha fazla ses için tuşlara çok güçlü vurmanıza gerek yoktur. Akordeon üzerinde, ekstra hacim elde etmek için körüğü daha fazla basınç veya hızda kullanırsınız.
mt: 1. Keep pressing the keys correctly while making sure your hand is as relaxed as possible - also try not to make any extra movements with your fingers. This way you will be as little tired as possible. Remember that you don't need to hit the keys very hard to get more sound, on the accordion you get extra volume by pressing the bellows harder or faster.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Bir filmi DVD formatına dönüştürmeye uğraşırken karşılaşılan ve en çok görülen sorunlardan birisi aşırı taramadır. Çoğu televizyon, kamuoyunu memnun edecek şekilde üretilmiştir. Bu nedenden dolayı televizyonda gördüğünüz her şey, kenarları kesilmiş üst, alt ve yanlara sahipti. Bu, görüntünün tüm ekranı kapladığından emin olmak için yapılır. Buna aşırı tarama denir. Bir DVD hazırladığınız zaman maalesef kenarlıkları da büyük ihtimalle kesilecek ve videonun alt kısmına çok yakın altyazılar varsa bunlar tam olarak görülemeyecek.
mt: 1 of the most common problems encountered while trying to convert a movie to DVD format is overscan. Most TVs are manufactured to be pleasing to the public. This means that everything you see on your TV has been cropped on the top, bottom and sides. This is done to ensure that the entire screen is covered. This is called overscan. When you create a DVD, unfortunately, the edges will most likely be cropped and if there are subtitles at the bottom of the video, they will not be seen clearly.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Amerikan Planı üç farklı noktadan başlatılan düzenli saldırılara dayanıyordu. General John Cadwalder, herhangi bir takviye gücününe mani olmak için Bordentown'daki İngiliz garnizonuna karşı oyalayıcı bir taarruz başlatacaktı. General James Ewing, Trenton Feribotu'nda nehir boyunca 700 milis götürecek, Assunpink Deresi üzerindeki köprüyü zaptedecek ve herhangi bir düşman birliğini kaçmaktan alıkoyacaktı. 2.400 kişiden oluşan ana taarruz gücü, Trenton'un dokuz mil kuzeyindeki nehri geçip daha sonra şafak öncesi bir taarruz gerçekleştirmek için biri Greene ve diğeri Sullivan komutasında olmak üzere iki gruba bölünecekti.
mt: The American plan was to launch regular attacks from three different points. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison in Bordentown to keep any reinforcements at bay. General James Ewing would ferry 700 militiamen across the river at the Trenton Ferry, capture the bridge over the Assunpink Creek, and prevent any enemy force from escaping. The main attack force of 2,400 men would split into two groups, one under Greene and the other under Sullivan, cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and launch an attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "4 Temmuz'da Kongre'deki kabulünden sonra, Kongre Başkanı John Hancock ve Katip Charles Thomson tarafından imzalanan el yazması bir taslak birkaç blok ötedeki John Dunlap'ın matbaa dükkanına gönderildi. Şimdi ""Dunlap broadsides"" olarak bilinen bildirilerden bir gecede 150 ila 200 kopya hazırlandı. Belgenin ilk halka açık biçimde okunması John Nixon tarafından 8 Temmuz'da Bağımsızlık Salonu'nun bahçesinde gerçekleşti. Bu belgelereden bir tanesi 9 Temmuz tarihinde New York'ta emrinde bulunan askerlerine okuması için 6 Temmuz'da George Washington'a yollandı. Bir kopya ise 10 Ağustos tarihinde Londra'ya ulaştı. Belgenin en eski kopyaları, hala var olduğu bilinen 25 Dunlap broşürdür. Geriye hiç orijinal el yazısı versiyonu kalmamıştır."
mt: 4 July, after its passage in Congress, a handwritten draft was sent to John Dunlap's printing shop a few blocks away by Congress President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson. 150 to 200 copies were prepared in a day from the broadsides. The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon on 8 July in the Independence Hall's yard. One copy was sent to George Washington in New York to read to his troops on 6 July. One copy reached London on 10 August. The oldest copies known are the 25 Dunlap broadsides. No original handwritten version is known to exist.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Bu faaliyeti gören Koloniciler de takviye kuvvet çağırdılar Öncü hatları sağlamlaştıran birlikler arasında, Albay John Stark ve Albay James Reed komutasındaki (her ikisi de daha sonra general oldu) 200 kişilik 1. ve 3. New Hampshire alayları da bulunuyordu. Stark'ın adamları, Yerleşimcilerin konumunun kuzey ucundaki çitlerin yanında pozisyon aldılar. Yarımadanın kuzeydoğusu boyunca yer alan Mystic Nehrinde su çekilmesi bir boşluk açtığında, küçük bir sahilde suyun kıyısında yer alan kuzey ucuna doğru çiti kısa bir taş duvarla genişlettiler. Gridley veya Stark çitin yaklaşık 100 fit (30 m) önüne bir kazık yerleştirdi ve askerlerin geçmesinden önce ateş açılmaması emrini verdi.
mt: 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments, under the command of Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both of whom later became generals), were also present. Stark's men positioned themselves along the fence line at the northern tip of the settlement, where the settlers' position was weakest. When the British drew water from the Mystic River, which ran along the northern tip of the peninsula, they opened a gap in the settlers' line by widening the fence line with a short stone wall at the northern tip. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no fire be opened until the soldiers had passed.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Antik Çin, farklı zaman dönemlerini göstermek konusunda özgün bir yol izlemiştir; Çin'in her dönemi veya iktidardaki her aile ayrı bir hanedanlıktır. Ayrıca her hanedanlık arasında bölünmüş bölgelerden oluşan istikrarsız bir dönem yaşandı. Bu dönemlerden en ünlüsü Han ve Jin Hanedanlıkları arasındaki 60 yıl boyunca süren Üç İmparatorluk çağıdır. Bu dönemlerde, taht için mücadele eden birçok soylu arasında şiddetli savaşlar meydana geldi. Antik Çin tarihinin en kanlı dönemlerinden biri olan Üç Krallık Dönemi'nde binlerce kişi Xi'an'daki büyük sarayda en yüksek mevkiye erişmek için savaşarak ölmüştür.
mt: Antiquity, China has taken an original way to show different time periods; each period or ruling family of China is a separate dynasty. Also, between each dynasty there was an unstable period of divided regions. The most famous of these periods is the 60-year Three Kingdoms period between the Han and Jin dynasties. During this time, many nobles fought for the throne and many wars took place. The Three Kingdoms period was one of the bloodiest periods in ancient Chinese history, in which thousands of people died fighting for the highest position in the great palace in Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Asker karınca kolonileri de farklı etaplarda yürür ve yuvalarını inşa eder. Göçebe evresinde, asker karıncalar geceleri yürür ve gündüzleri konaklamak için durur. Koloni, mevcut gıda azaldığında göçebelik dönemine geçer. Bu aşamada her gün değiştirilen geçici yuvalar inşa edilir. Bu göçebe taşkınlıklarının ve yürüyüşlerinin her biri yaklaşık 17 gün sürer.
mt: Ant colonies also march in different stages and build their nests. In the nomadic phase, soldier ants march at night and rest during the day to build their nests. The colony passes into the nomadic phase when the existing food supply decreases. At this stage, temporary nests are built every day. Each of these nomadic outbursts and marches lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Fizyolojide ve hareketlerde gözlenen birçok ritim, çoğunlukla önemli derecede içsel döngülerin varlığına ve bu döngülerin biyolojik saatler aracılığıyla üretilmesine bağlıdır. Sadece dışsal periyodik ipuçlarına yanıt olmayan periyodik ritimler, bakteriler, mantarlar, bitkiler ve hayvanlar dahil çoğu canlı varlıkta belgelenmiştir. Biyolojik saatler, dışarıdan gelen işaretlerin yokluğunda bile bir serbest döngü periyodunu devam ettirerek kendi kendini idame ettiren osilatörlerdir.
mt: Many rhythms observed in physiology and movement are due to the presence of significant internal oscillators and the production of these oscillators by biological clocks. Periodic rhythms that are not in response to external periodic cues have been documented in most living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Popülasyon, belirli bir coğrafi alandaki belirli bir türe ait canlıların tamamıdır. Bir popülasyondaki tüm bireyler belli bir fenotip özelliği bakımından birbirinin aynısıysa monomorfik olarak bilinirler. Bireyler belirli bir özelliğin çeşitli biçimlerini gösterdiğinde polimorfiktirler.
mt: A population is the entire collection of individuals of a particular species in a given geographic area. If all individuals in a population have the same phenotype, they are said to be monomorphic. If individuals exhibit different forms of a particular trait, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Popülasyon, belirli bir coğrafi alandaki belirli bir türe ait canlıların tamamıdır. Bir popülasyondaki tüm bireyler belli bir fenotip özelliği bakımından birbirinin aynısıysa monomorfik olarak bilinirler. Bireyler belirli bir özelliğin çeşitli biçimlerini gösterdiğinde polimorfiktirler.

When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Doğa temelli turizm, bitki ve hayvan yaban hayatı da dahil olmak üzere manzaranın tadını çıkarmak amacıyla doğal alanları ziyaret etmeye ilgi duyan insanları çekiyor. Yerinde etkinlik örnekleri avcılık, balıkçılık, fotoğrafçılık, kuş seyri ile parkları ziyaret ve ekosistem hakkında bilgileri incelemekten oluşur. Bir örnek de Borneo'daki orangutanları ziyaret etmek, fotoğraflarını çekmek ve haklarında bilgi edinmektir.
mt: Nature-based tourism is attracting people to visit natural areas to enjoy the scenery, including wildlife such as plants and animals. On-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, visiting parks and learning about ecosystems. An example is visiting orangutans in Borneo, taking photos and learning about them.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Her sabah, iş yerlerine gitmek için insanlar arabalara binerek küçük taşra kasabalarından ayrılır ve iş yerlerine gitmek için kendilerinin biraz önce ayrıldığı yere gidecek diğer çalışanların yanından geçer. Bu dinamik karşılıklı ulaşım seferlerinde herkes, bir şekilde, özel arabalara dayalı bir ulaşım sistemine bağlı ve bunu destekliyor. Bilim, bu devasa karbon ekonomisinin, son iki milyon yıldır insan evrimini destekleyen istikrarlı biyosfer durumunu bozduğunu gösteriyor.
mt: Every morning, people leave small rural towns in cars to go to work, and other workers will pass by the place where they themselves just left, to go to work. This dynamic two-way traffic is based on a massive carbon economy, which is shown by science to be disrupting the stable biosphere condition that has supported human evolution for the last two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atom, tüm maddelerin esas yapı elemanlarından biri olarak kabul edilir. Temel bir Bohr tasarımına göre şekil olarak güneşin yörüngesinde dönme hareketi yapan gezegenlere benzeyen, elektronların yörüngesinde bulunan merkezi yapıya sahip bir çekirdekten meydana gelen çok karmaşık bir varlık (bkz. Şekil 1.1). Çekirdek, nötronlar ve protonlar olmak üzere iki parçacıktan oluşur. Protonlar pozitif elektrik yüküne sahipken nötronların yükü yoktur. Elektronlar negatif elektrik yüküne sahiptir.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Günümüzde kullanımda olan neredeyse tüm bilgisayarlar, ikili değer şeklinde kodlanmış bilgilerin suistimaline dayanır. İkili sayı, 0 ve 1 değerlerinden yalnızca birine sahip olabilir. Bunlara bilişim teknolojileri alanında bit denir.
mt: 0 and 1 are the only values that a binary digit, or bit, can have. In computing and telecommunications, binary digits are often called bits.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Ayrıca bloglar, öğrencilerin yazımını geliştirmeye yardımcı olabilir. Öğrenciler blog deneyimlerine genellikle özensiz dilbilgisi ve yazım hatalarıyla başlarken bir okuyucu kitlenin varlığı, genellikle bunu değiştirir. En eleştirel kitle genelde öğrenciler olduğundan blog yazarları eleştiriden kaçınmak için yazısını geliştirmeye çalışır. Blog yazmak ""öğrencileri etraflarındaki dünya hakkında daha bilinçli olmaya zorlar"". Takipçilerin ilgilerini besleme ihtiyacı öğrencilere zeki ve ilgi çekici olma konusunda ilham verir (Toto, 2004). Blog yazma, işbirliğine kapı aralayan ve öğrencilerin öğrenmeyi, geleneksel okul müfredatının çok ötesine taşımaya teşvik eden bir araçtır. Blogların uygun kullanımı ""öğrencilerin daha analitik ve eleştirel olmalarını sağlayabilir; öğrenciler internet materyallerine aktif olarak tepki vererek başkalarının yazıları bağlamında konumlarını ve belirli konularda kendi bakış açılarını belirleyebilir (Oravec, 2002)."
mt: "In addition, blogs can help students improve their writing. Students often begin their blogging experiences with careless grammar and spelling, but the presence of a readership often prompts them to improve. The most critical audience is usually other students, so bloggers often try to improve their writing to avoid criticism. The need to attract the attention of followers inspires students to be smart and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is an instrument that opens up to collaboration and encourages students to learn beyond the traditional school curriculum. The appropriate use of blogs ""can help students become more analytical and critical; students can actively respond to Internet materials to position themselves and their own perspectives on specific issues in the context of others' writings (Oravec, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Eşzamansız iletişim, düşünme ve başkalarına tepki verme zamanını teşvik eder. Öğrencilere kendi hızlarında çalışma ve öğretim bilgisinin hızını kontrol etme becerisini sağlar. Ayrıca, esnek çalışma saati ihtimali ile daha az zaman sınırlaması vardır. (Bremer, 1998) İnternet ve World Wide Web kullanımı, öğrencilerin bilgiye her an ulaşmalarına imkan tanır. Öğrenciler bir sonraki yüz yüze görüşmeyi beklemek yerine günün her anında eğitmenlere sorularını iletebilirler ve oldukça hızlı bir geri dönüş bekleyebilirler.
mt: Asynchronous communication encourages thinking and responding to others at one's own pace. It gives students the ability to control the speed of their learning and the speed of their information intake. (Bremer, 1998) Internet and World Wide Web usage allows students to access information at any time. Students can pose questions to instructors at any time of the day and expect a quick response.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Geleneksel ortaçağ kaleleri uzun süredir hayal gücüne ilham vererek mızrak dövüşleri, ziyafetler ve Arthur şövalyeleri imajlarını ortaya çıkardı. Bin yıllık harabelerin ortasında dururken bile akla çok önceden bitmiş savaşların seslerini ve kokularını getirmek, neredeyse kaldırım taşlarına çarpan toynakların seslerini ve zindan çukurlarından yükselen korkuyu duymak kolaydır. Fakat hayal gücümüz gerçeğe mi dayanıyor? Kaleler başta neden inşa edilmişti? Nasıl tasarlanıp inşa edilmişlerdi?
mt: For centuries, medieval castles have inspired the imagination with images of jousting, feasting and Arthurian knights. Standing amid the ruins of a thousand-year-old fortress, it is easy to conjure up the sounds and smells of battles long since finished, the clatter of hooves on cobblestones and the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination grounded in reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Yapıldığı dönemi yansıtan Kirby Muxloe Kalesi, kaleden çok surlarla çevrilmiş bir eve benzer. Büyük sırlı pencereleri ve ince duvarları, kararlı bir saldırıya uzun bir süre direnemezdi. 1480'lerde, Lord Hastings tarafından yapımına başlandığında ülke göreceli olarak barışçıldı ve sadece küçük mobil yağmacı gruplarına karşı savunma yapmak gerekliydi.
mt: Built in the time it reflects, Kirby Muxloe Castle resembles a house more than a castle, with its large casement windows and thin walls, which would not have been able to withstand a sustained attack for long. In the 1480s, when it was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and only small mobile raiding parties were necessary to defend against.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Çeyrek mil koşusunun yarım mil koşusuna dönüşmesiyle birlikte, hız çok daha az önemli hale geliyor ve dayanıklılık mutlak bir gereklilik haline geliyor. İki dakikadan daha kısa bir sürede koşuyu tamamlayabilen birinci sınıf bir yarım mil koşucusu elbette yüksek bir hıza sahiptir ancak  tüm tehlikelere karşı dayanıklılık geliştirmelidir. Koşu sezonu için en iyi hazırlık kışın biraz kros koşusu ile üst vücut için spor salonu çalışmalarıdır.
mt: With the quarter-mile race turning into a half-mile race, speed is less important and endurance is an absolute necessity. A first-class half-mile runner will certainly have a high speed, but he must develop endurance against all hazards. The best preparation for the race season is a little cross-country running in the winter and upper body gym work.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Doğru beslenme uygulamaları bir başına üst düzey performanslar ortaya çıkarmaz, fakat genç sporcuların genel sağlık durumunu önemli ölçüde etkileyebilir. Sağlıklı bir enerji dengesinin sağlanması, etkili su alımı alışkanlıklarının uygulanması ve ek besin alımının çeşitli yönlerinin anlaşılması, sporcuların performanslarını artırmasına ve spordan aldıkları hazzın artmasına yardımcı olabilir.
mt: Appropriate nutrition practices alone do not produce elite performances, but can significantly affect the overall health of young athletes. Establishing a healthy energy balance, implementing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation can help athletes improve their performance and enhance the enjoyment they get from sports.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Orta mesafe koşusu nispeten ekonomik bir spordur; fakat, katılmak için gereken birkaç ekipman parçasıyla ilgili pek çok yanlış düşünce vardır. Ürünler ihtiyaç duyulduğunda satın alınabilir, fakat çoğunun performans üzerinde çok az etkisi olacaktır veya hiç olmayacaktır. Sporcular, hiçbir gerçek yarar sağlamadığında bile bir ürünü tercih etmeyi isteyebilirler.
mt: Middle-distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions about the few pieces of equipment required. Items can be purchased when needed, but most will have little or no effect on performance, even if the athlete prefers them.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: "MRI, Felix Bloch (Stanford Üniversitesi) ve Edward Purcell (Harvard Üniversitesi) tarafından 1930'lu yıllarda bulunan nükleer manyetik rezonans (NMR) adında bir fizik olgusuna dayanıyor. Bu rezonansta manyetik alan ve radyo dalgaları, atomların küçük radyo sinyalleri vermesine sebep olur. 1970 yılında, bir tıp doktoru ve araştırmacı bilim adamı olan Raymond Damadian, manyetik rezonans görüntüleme yöntemini tıbbi teşhis için bir araç olarak kullanmanın temellerini attı. 4 sene sonra dünyanın MRI alanındaki ilk patenti olan bir patent verildi. 1977'de Dr. Damadian, ""Indomitable"" adını verdiği ilk ""bütün vücut"" MRI tarayıcısının yapımını tamamladı."
mt: "MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), discovered by Felix Bloch (Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (Harvard University) in the 1930s. In this resonance, magnetic fields and radio waves cause atoms to emit tiny radio signals. In 1970, a physician and research scientist named Raymond Damadian laid the groundwork for using magnetic resonance imaging as a diagnostic tool in medicine. Four years later, the first patent in the world for MRI was issued. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first ""whole body"" MRI scanner, which he named ""Indomitable""."
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: İnsanlar başkalarının zihinlerini okuma konusunda açık ara en yetenekli türdür. Bu, öteki insanların algıladıklarını, amaçlarını, inançlarını, bildiklerini ve isteklerini başarıyla öngörebildiğimiz anlamına gelir. Bu yetenekler arasında, diğerlerinin niyetlerini anlamak kritik öneme sahiptir. Bu bizim fiziksel eylemlerin olası belirsizliklerini çözmemizi sağlar. Örneğin, birinin bir arabanın camını kırdığını görseniz, muhtemelen o kişinin bir yabancının arabasını çalmaya çalıştığını varsayarsınız. Araba anahtarlarını kaybetmiş ve zorla girmeye çalıştığı kendi arabası olsa idi o zaman farklı bir şekilde yargılanması gerekirdi.
mt: People are the most adept species at reading the minds of others. This means we can successfully predict what others perceive, intend, believe, know, and desire. Among these abilities, understanding others' intentions is critical. This allows us to solve the possible ambiguities of their physical actions. For example, if you see someone break a car window, you probably assume that person is trying to steal a car. If that person had lost his car keys and was trying to break into his own car, you would have a different opinion.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: İnsanlar başkalarının zihinlerini okuma konusunda açık ara en yetenekli türdür. Bu, öteki insanların algıladıklarını, amaçlarını, inançlarını, bildiklerini ve isteklerini başarıyla öngörebildiğimiz anlamına gelir. Bu yetenekler arasında, diğerlerinin niyetlerini anlamak kritik öneme sahiptir. Bu bizim fiziksel eylemlerin olası belirsizliklerini çözmemizi sağlar. Örneğin, birinin bir arabanın camını kırdığını görseniz, muhtemelen o kişinin bir yabancının arabasını çalmaya çalıştığını varsayarsınız. Araba anahtarlarını kaybetmiş ve zorla girmeye çalıştığı kendi arabası olsa idi o zaman farklı bir şekilde yargılanması gerekirdi.
mt: People are the most adept species at reading the minds of others. This means we can successfully predict what others perceive, intend, believe, know, and desire. Among these abilities, understanding others' intentions is critical. This allows us to solve the possible ambiguities of their physical actions. For example, if you see someone break a car window, you probably assume that person is trying to steal a car. If that person had lost his car keys and was trying to break into his own car, you would have a different opinion.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: AI, bilim kurgu ile güçlü bir çağrışıma sahip olsa da, AI bir makinede davranış, öğrenme ve akıllı adaptasyonla ilgilenen bilgisayar biliminin çok önemli bir dalı oluşturur. Yapay zeka araştırmaları, akıllı davranış gerektiren görevlerin otomatikleştirilmesini sağlayacak robotlar geliştirmeyi içerir. Örnekler arasında kontrol, planlama ve programlama, müşteri tanılarına ve sorularına cevap verme; el yazısı, ses ve yüz tanıma becerileri yer almaktadır. Bu becerilerin her biri, gerçek hayatın sorunlarına çözüm sağlamaya odaklanan ayrı disiplinler haline geldi. Yapay zeka sistemleri, ev bilgisayarlarında ve video oyun yazılımlarında bulunduğu gibi artık sıklıkla ekonomi, tıp, mühendislik ve askeri alanlarda da kullanılıyor.
mt: AI, while strongly associated with science fiction, is a major branch of computer science that deals with behavior, learning, and intelligent adaptation in machines. Artificial intelligence research includes developing robots that automate tasks requiring intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning, and programming, customer service and answering questions; handwriting, speech, and face recognition abilities. Each of these abilities has become its own discipline focused on solving real-world problems. AI systems are now commonly used in economics, medicine, engineering, and the military, as well as in home computers and video game software.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Yakınsak düşünce kalıpları bir çözüme ulaşmak için farklı fikirleri veya alanları birleştiren problem çözme teknikleridir. Bu akıl yapısının odak noktası olan hız, mantık ve kesinlik, aynı zamanda gerçeklerin belirlenmesi, mevcut teknikleri yeniden uygulaması ve bilgi toplamadır. Bu düşünce şeklinin en önemli unsuru tek bir doğru cevap olmasıdır. Sadece iki yanıt düşünürsünüz, doğru veya yanlış. Bu düşünüş biçimi belli bilimler ve standart prosedürlerle ilişkilendirilmiştir. Bu düşünüş tarzına sahip insanlar mantıklı düşünmeye sahiptir, paternleri ezberleyebilir, problemleri çözebilir ve bilimsel testlerde çalışabilir.

ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Video görüntülerinden faydalanılması, mimiklerin yorumlanmasında, birkaç milisaniye devam eden yüz hareketlerinde önemli keşiflere yol açmıştır. Özellikle mikro ifadeleri doğru bir şekilde yorumlama yöntemi ile bir kişinin yalan söyleyip söylemediğinin anlaşılabileceği öne sürülüyor. Oliver Sacks, The President's Speech olarak adlandırılan makalesinde, beyin hasarı sebebi ile konuşmayı düzgün bir biçimde algılamakta problem yaşayan insanların bu soruna rağmen samimiyeti doğru bir şekilde değerlendirebildiğini belirtti. Hatta, insan davranışını yorumlamadaki bu tür yeteneklere evcil köpekler gibi hayvanların da sahip olabileceğini iddia ediyor.
mt: Using video footage, facial expressions can be analyzed, and important discoveries have been made in a few milliseconds of facial movements. It is suggested that a method of correctly interpreting micro-expressions can determine whether a person is lying or not. Oliver Sacks, in his article The President's Speech, noted that people with problems in understanding speech correctly could still correctly interpret sincerity. He even claims that animals such as dogs may have such abilities to interpret human behavior.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Bilgi edinme ve öğrenme yetisi yukarıda bahsedildiği şekilde değiştikçe bilgi edinimindeki temel oran değişti. Bilgi elde etmeye yönelik yaklaşım farklıydı. Baskı artık bireysel hatırlama üzerinde değildi ve metin hatırlamaya odaklanılıyordu. Özünde, Rönesans öğrenme yaklaşımı ve bilginin yayılması konusunda önemli değişikliklere yol açmıştır.
mt: As the ability to acquire and learn information changed as described above, the fundamental ratio of information acquisition changed. The approach to acquiring information was different. The pressure was no longer on individual recall and was focused on remembering text. In essence, the Renaissance learning approach and the dissemination of information have led to significant changes.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: İnternet, hem kitle iletişim hem de bireylerarası iletişim elemanlarını bir araya getirir. İnternetin belirgin özellikleri, kullanım ve memnuniyet yaklaşımı açısından ek boyutlar kazandırır. Mesela, “öğrenme” ve “sosyalleşme”, İnternet kullanımı için önemli motivasyonlar olarak tavsiye edilmektedir (James ve diğerleri, 1995). İzleyicilerin internet sitelerine tepkilerini araştırdıklarında, “şahsi katılım” ve “sürdürülen ilişkiler” Eighmey ve McCord (1998) tarafından yeni teşvik unsurları olarak da tanımlanmıştır.
mt: 1. Internet brings together mass communication and interpersonal communication elements. Internet's distinctive features add new dimensions to usage and satisfaction approach. For example, "learning" and "socialization" are recommended as important motivations for Internet usage (James and others, 1995). When Eighmey and McCord (1998) investigated the audience's reactions to Internet sites, they defined "personal participation" and "sustained relationships" as new incentives.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gotik tarz 10. ile 11. yüzyıllar arasında ve 14. yüzyılda zirve yapmıştır. Başlangıçta giyim doğudaki Bizans kültüründen büyük ölçüde etkilenmiştir. Ancak, iletişim kanallarının yavaş olması nedeniyle batıdaki tarzlar 25 ila 30 yıl geriden gelebiliyordu. Orta Çağ'ın sonlarına doğru Batı Avrupa kendi tarzını oluşturmaya başladı. Haçlı seferlerinin son bulmasıyla dönemin en büyük ilerlemelerinden biri halkın kıyafetlerini iliklemek için düğme kullanmaya başlamasıydı.
mt: 10th and 11th centuries and peaked in the 14th century. Initially, clothing was greatly influenced by Byzantine culture from the east. However, due to slow communication channels, western styles were lagging behind by 25 to 30 years. In the late Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the biggest advances of the era was the use of buttons to fasten clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Çevreye karşı daha duyarlı yaşamaya başlayabilir, çevrecilik hareketlerine katılabilir, hatta geleceğin sorunlarını biraz olsun azaltabilmek için aktivist bile olabiliriz. Bu çoğu durumda semptomatik tedavi gibidir. Ancak, sadece geçici bir çözüm istemiyorsak o zaman sorunların kökenini bulmalı ve onları etkisizleştirmeliyiz. İnsanoğlunun bilimsel ve teknolojik ilerlemeleri nedeniyle dünyanın çok değiştiği, sorunların aşırı nüfus ve insanlığın savurgan yaşam tarzı nedeniyle sorunların daha da büyük hale geldiği yeterince açıktır.
mt: We can become more environmentally conscious, join environmental movements, even become activists to help reduce future problems. This is often symptomatic treatment. But if we don't want a temporary solution, we need to find the root of the problems and neutralize them. It is clear enough that the world has changed a lot due to human scientific and technological progress, and that the problems are getting bigger due to overpopulation and the wasteful lifestyle of humanity.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Güç dengesi, Avrupa milletlerinin tüm Avrupa devletlerinin milli egemenliklerini korumasını amaçlayan bir sistemdi. Konsept, tüm Avrupa uluslarının tek bir ulusun güçlenmesini engellemek zorunda kalmasıydı ve bu nedenle ulusal hükümetler genellikle dengeyi korumak amacıyla ittifaklarını sıkça değiştiriyorlardı. İspanyol Veraset Savaşı ana meselesi güçler dengesi olan ilk savaştır. Avrupalı güçlerin artık dini savaşları olduğu bahanesine sahip olamayacağı ile bu, önemli bir değişime işaret ediyordu. Böylelikle Otuz Yıl Savaşları, dini savaş olarak sınıflandırılan son savaş olacaktı.
mt: The balance of power was a system designed to preserve the national sovereignties of all European states. The concept was that all European nations would be forced to prevent the strengthening of a single nation, and as a result national governments frequently changed their alliances in order to preserve the balance. The Spanish Succession War was the first war with the main issue of the balance of power. With the fact that European powers could no longer claim religious wars, this was a sign of an important change. Thus, the Thirty Years War would be the last war to be classified as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Güç dengesi, Avrupa milletlerinin tüm Avrupa devletlerinin milli egemenliklerini korumasını amaçlayan bir sistemdi. Konsept, tüm Avrupa uluslarının tek bir ulusun güçlenmesini engellemek zorunda kalmasıydı ve bu nedenle ulusal hükümetler genellikle dengeyi korumak amacıyla ittifaklarını sıkça değiştiriyorlardı. İspanyol Veraset Savaşı ana meselesi güçler dengesi olan ilk savaştır. Avrupalı güçlerin artık dini savaşları olduğu bahanesine sahip olamayacağı ile bu, önemli bir değişime işaret ediyordu. Böylelikle Otuz Yıl Savaşları, dini savaş olarak sınıflandırılan son savaş olacaktı.
mt: The balance of power was a system designed to preserve the national sovereignties of all European states. The concept was that all European nations would be forced to prevent the strengthening of a single nation, and as a result national governments frequently changed their alliances in order to preserve the balance. The Spanish Succession War was the first war with the main issue of the balance of power. With the fact that European powers could no longer claim religious wars, this was a sign of an important change. Thus, the Thirty Years War would be the last war to be classified as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Avrupa tarihinin bu dönemi sırasında, zengin ve güçlü hale gelmiş olan Katolik Kilisesi denetim altına alınmıştır. Bin yıldan fazla bir süredir Hıristiyan dini, dil ve geleneklerdeki farklılıklara rağmen Avrupa devletlerini bir arada tutmuştu. Ben Her yeri saran gücü, kraldan avam tabakaya kadar herkesi etkiledi. Hristiyanlığın en önemli inançlarından birisi zenginliğin ızdırap ve yoksulluğu hafifletmesi için kullanılmasıdır ve kilisenin sermayesi özellikle bu amaçla kullanılır. Kilisenin merkezi otoritesi bin yılı aşkın süredir Roma'da bulunuyordu. Güç ve paranın burada yoğunlaşması birçok kişinin bu ilkeye uygun davranılıp davranılmadığını sorgulamasına neden oldu.
mt: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church had become rich and powerful. For over a thousand years, Christianity had held the various European states together despite their differences in language, culture, and religion. I believe that the power of the Church extended to everyone from the king to the common man. One of the most important tenets of Christianity is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty, and the Church's wealth was especially used for this purpose. The central authority of the Church had been in Rome for over a thousand years. The concentration of power and money there led many people to question whether the Church was acting in accordance with this principle.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Dehşete düşen Kral On Altıncı Louis, iki küçük çocuğu, (11 yaşındaki Marie Therese ve dört yaşındaki Louis-Charles) Kraliçe Marie Antoinette ve Kralın kız kardeşi Madam Elizabeth kalabalık bir kadın grubu tarafından 6 Ekim 1789 tarihinde zorla Versay'dan Paris'e sürüldü. Kral ve Kraliçe'ye karşı bağıran ve tehditler savuran bir grup insanla çevrili olarak bir arabayla Paris'e geri döndüler. İnsan topluluğu Kral ve Kraliçe'yi arabanın pencerelerini açmaya mecbur bıraktı. Bir noktada kalabalıktan biri, korkmuş Kraliçe'nin önünde Versailles'da canı alınan bir kraliyet muhafızının başını salladı.
mt: 6 October 1789, King Louis XVI, his two young children (11-year-old Marie Therese and four-year-old Louis-Charles), Queen Marie Antoinette and the King's sister Madame Elizabeth were forcibly removed from Versailles to Paris by a large crowd of women who were shouting and threatening the King and Queen. They were surrounded by a group of people who were threatening the King and Queen. They were forced to open the windows of the carriage and were forced to return to Paris. At one point, one of the crowd held up the head of a royal guard who had been killed in Versailles in front of the frightened Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Savaşın başlamasından hemen sonra İngiltere, Almanya'ya deniz ablukası uygulamıştır. Bu kuşatma, geçen iki asırda pek çok uluslararası sözleşmede genel kanunlar olarak kabul görmüş uluslararası hukuku ihlal ediyor olmasına rağmen stratejik olarak etkili oldu ve hayati önem taşıyan askeri ve sivil malzemelerin ulaştırılmasına engel oldu. İngiltere, herhangi bir geminin okyanusun tamamına girmesini önlemek için uluslararası sulara mayın döşeyerek tarafsız gemiler için bile tehlike oluşturdu. Bu taktiğe sınırlı bir yanıt verildiği için Almanya serbest olan denizaltı savaşına benzer bir yanıt verileceğini bekliyordu.
mt: Immediately after the war started, England imposed a naval blockade on Germany. This blockade, which violated international law as accepted in many international treaties as general laws, was strategically effective and prevented the transportation of vital military and civilian materials. England laid mines in international waters to prevent any ship from crossing the entire ocean, posing a threat even to neutral ships. Germany expected a limited response to this tactic and was expecting a similar response to submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Amerika Birleşik Devletleri'nde bilinen yaklaşık 400.000 Multipl Skleroz (MS) vakası vardır. Bu, daha genç ve orta yaşlı yetişkinlerde en çok görülen gelen nörolojik hastalığın Multipl Skleroz (MS) olduğu anlamına gelir. MS; beyin, omurilik ve optik sinirden oluşan merkezi sinir sistemini etkileyen bir hastalıktır. Araştırmalar kadınların erkeklere kıyasla MS olmaya iki kat daha yatkın olduğunu göstermiştir.
mt: 400,000 known Multiple Sclerosis (MS) cases exist in the United States. This means that Multiple Sclerosis (MS) is the most common neurological disorder affecting young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which includes the brain, spinal cord and optic nerve. Studies have shown that women are twice as likely to develop MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Araştırmalar, bel ağrısından dolayı acı ya da sakatlık yaşayan insanların depresyon, güçlü korku veya travma geçirmiş olmaları ile aralarında bir bağlantı olabileceğini ortaya çıkarttı. Depresyon ve korku değil sadece felaket senaryoları kurmanın etkileri haftalık düzenli fiziksel aktivitelerin önkoşuluydu. Düzenli aktiviteye katılanlar, kronik ağrı ile normal fiziksel hareketten doğan rahatsızlık hissi arasında ayrım yapan negatif ağrı algısı bakımından daha fazla desteğe ihtiyaç duymuştur.
mt: Research has found that people who suffer from back pain may be more likely to experience depression, strong fear or trauma. Depression and fear were not the only factors, but the effects of imagining disaster scenarios were a prerequisite for weekly regular physical activity. Those who participated in regular activity were more in need of support in terms of negative pain perception, which distinguishes between chronic pain and discomfort from physical movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Modern eskrim sporu; üniversite öğrencileri arasında, profesyonel ve olimpik yarışmalarda, yani birçok farklı seviyede oynanır. Spor, esas olarak bir eskrimcinin diğeriyle düello yapması şeklinde bir düello formatı içerisinde oynanır.
mt: Fencing is a modern sport; it is played by university students, professionals and in Olympic competitions, that is, at many different levels. The sport is played in a duel format where a fencer fights another fencer.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: İç zehirlenme hemen ortaya çıkmayabilir. Kusma gibi belirtiler hemen tanı konulamayacak kadar geneldir. İç zehirlenmenin en önemli belirtisi, açık bir ilaç kabı veya zehirli ev kimyasalları bulunması olabilir. Söz konusu zehir için özel ilk yardım talimatlarını görmek amacıyla etiketi kontrol et.
mt: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Vomiting is a symptom that may not be specific enough to diagnose internal poisoning. The most important sign of internal poisoning is the presence of an empty pill bottle or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for special first aid instructions for the poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Kurbanı kontrol ederken, güvenliğinizi temin etmek için öncelikle olay yerini incelemelisiniz. Ona yaklaştığınızda kurbanın pozisyonunu ve bazı ani tehlike işaretlerini fark etmeniz gerekir. Yardım etmeye çalışırken yaralanırsan, yalnızca işlerin daha kötüye gitmesine yardımcı olmuş olabilirsin.
mt: 1. First, you should inspect the scene to ensure your safety. As you approach the scene, you should be aware of the victim's position and some sudden danger signs. While trying to help, you may be injured, and you may only have made things worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Metrik sistemin kullanılması, mutlakiyetçilikten cumhuriyetçiliğe geçiş, milliyetçilik ve ülkenin tek bir hükümdara değil halka ait olduğu inancı gibi pek çok sosyal ve politik etki var. Yine Devrim'den sonra meslekler, en hırslı ve başarılı olanın kazanmasını sağlayacak şekilde tüm erkek adaylara açıktı. Aynı şey ordu için de geçerlidir çünkü ordu sıralamaları sınıfa göre değil artık Cailaber'e dayannmaktadır. Fransız Devrimi, diğer ülkelerde baskı altında bulunan birçok işçi sınıfı mensubuna da kendi devrimlerini başlatma ilhamını verdi.
mt: 1. The use of the metric system, the transition from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief that the country belongs to the people not a single ruler. 2. After the Revolution, professions were open to all male candidates, the most ambitious and successful. The same is true for the army because army rankings are no longer based on class but on Cailaber. The French Revolution inspired many working-class members of other countries who were oppressed to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Herkes toplumun bir parçası ve ulaşım sistemlerini kullanıyor. Neredeyse herkes ulaşım sistemlerinden şikayet ediyor. Gelişmiş ülkelerde su kalitesi ya da köprülerin çökmesi gibi benzeri düzeyde şikayetleri nadiren duyarsınız. Neden ulaşım sistemleri böylesine şikayetleri alıyor, neden bunlar günlük bazda başarısız? Ulaşım mühendisleri beceriksiz mi? Yoksa daha temel bir sorun mu var?
mt: 1. Everyone is a part of society and uses the transportation system. Almost everyone complains about the transportation system. In developed countries, you rarely hear similar complaints about water quality or bridges collapsing. Why are transportation systems so complaint-prone? Are transportation engineers incompetent? Or is there a more fundamental problem?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Trafik Akışı, bireysel sürücülerin ve araçların iki nokta arasındaki hareketlerinin ve birbirleriyle kurdukları etkileşimlerin araştırılmasıdır. Maalesef, trafik akışı üzerinde çalışmak zordur çünkü sürücü davranışı yüzde yüz doğrulukla tahmin edilemeyebilir. Neyse ki, sürücüler makul surette istikrarlı bir aralıkta davranma eğilimi gösterir; böylelikle, trafik akışları kabul edilebilir bir tutarlılığa sahip olma eğilimi gösterir ve kabaca matematiksel olarak betimlenebilir. Trafik akışını daha iyi temsil etmek için, üç ana özellik arasındaki ilişkiler belirlenmiştir: (1) akış, (2) yoğunluk ve (3) hız. Bu ilişkiler, karayolu tesislerinin planlanmasına, tasarımına ve işletilmesine yardımcı olur.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of the movements and interactions of individual drivers and vehicles between two points. Unfortunately, it is difficult to work with traffic flow because driver behavior cannot be predicted with 100% accuracy. However, drivers tend to behave within a reasonable range of consistency; thus, traffic flows tend to exhibit a reasonable degree of consistency and can be roughly mathematically described. Three main features have been identified between the relationships: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and operating road facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: The Hershey and Chase deneyi, DNA'nın genetik bir madde olduğuna dair önde gelen önerilerinden biriydi. Hershey ve Chase, kendilerine ait DNA'ları bir bakteriye implantasyon yöntemi ile yerleştirmek amacıyla faj ve virüslerden yararlandı. DNA'yı ya radyoaktif fosforlu fajda ya da radyoaktif sülfürlü portein fajında işaretleyerek 2 deney yaptılar.
mt: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading proposals that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phage and virus to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They labeled the DNA either with radioactive phosphorus in a phage or with radioactive sulfur in a protein phage.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutasyonlar, mutasyon türüne, etkilenen genetik materyal parçasının önemine ve etkilenen hücrelerin germ hattı hücreleri olup olmamasına göre bir çok farklı etkiye sahip olabilir. Sırf germ hattı hücrelerinde oluşan mutasyonlar çocuklar üzerinde etkisini gösterebilirken, başka bölgelerde oluşan mutasyonlar hücre ölümüne veya kansere sebebiyet verebilir.
mt: Mutations can have a wide variety of effects, ranging from benign to catastrophic. Mutations in germ cells can give rise to uncontrolled cell growth, which is cancer, or to genetic disorders in offspring. Mutations in somatic cells can result in cell death or in benign or malignant tumors.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Mutasyonlar, mutasyon türüne, etkilenen genetik materyal parçasının önemine ve etkilenen hücrelerin germ hattı hücreleri olup olmamasına göre bir çok farklı etkiye sahip olabilir. src: Keçilerin ilk kez yaklaşık 10.000 yıl önce İran'ın Zagros Dağları'nda evcilleştirildikleri tahmin edilmektedir. Antik kültürler ve kabileler süte, yüne, ete ve posta kolay erişim için onları beslemeye başladı. Evcil keçiler genellikle tepelerde ya da diğer otlak bölgelerinde gezen sürüler halinde tutulurlardı, genellikle çocuk ya da ergen olan keçi çobanları tarafından daha yaygın biçimde bilinen çobanlara benzer biçimde güdülürlerdi. Bu gütme yöntemi bugün hala kullanılmaktadır.
mt: 10,000 years ago, goats were first domesticated in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to feed them for easy access to milk, wool, meat, and fur. Domestic goats were usually kept in herds in the hills or other grazing areas, and were driven by goat herders, usually children or adolescents, in a manner similar to the herding of sheep. This herding method is still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf, oyuncuların sopalarla toplara vurarak onları deliklere sokmaya çalıştıkları bir oyundur. Normal bir turda on sekiz delikle oynanır ve oyuncular genellikle sahadaki ilk delikle başlar ve on sekizinci delikle bitirirler. Kulübün, parkuru tamamlamak için en az vuruşunu veya savuruşunu yapan oyuncusu kazanır. Oyun çimen üzerinde oynanır ve deliğin etrafında bulunan çimenler daha kısa bir şekilde ve yeşil olarak adlandırılır.
mt: Golf is a sport in which players hit balls with clubs into holes in the ground. In a normal round, eighteen holes are played, and players usually start with the first hole and finish with the eighteenth. The club wins the round if its player makes the fewest or fewest number of strokes to complete the course. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is shorter and called green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Bilimin temel amacı, bilimsel yöntemle dünyanın nasıl işlemekte olduğunu ortaya çıkarmaktır. Bu yöntem aslında çoğu bilimsel araştırmaya yön gösterir. Fakat deneyler tek başına değildir. Deney, olası hipotezlerden bir ya da daha fazlasını elemek, sorular sormak için kullanılan bir testtir, gözlem yapmak da bilimsel araştırmalara rehberlik eder.
mt: The main purpose of science is to discover how the world works by means of the scientific method. This method actually guides most scientific research. But experiments alone are not enough. Experiments are a test to eliminate one or more possible hypotheses, to ask questions, and to observe.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Kasırgalar diğer şiddetli fırtınalara kıyasla küçük bir alanı etkilerler fakat önlerine çıkan her şeyi yok edebilirler. Kasırgalar ağaçları söker, binalardan tahtaları söker ve arabaları gökyüzüne fırlatır. Kasırgaların en şiddetli yüzde ikisi üç saatten fazla dayanır. Bu canavar fırtınalarının 480 km/saate (133m/s;300m/s) ulaşan rüzgarları vardır.
mt: Hurricanes affect a small area compared to other severe storms, but can destroy everything in their path. Hurricanes rip trees out of the ground, strip shingles off buildings and fling cars into the air. The most violent hurricanes last for three days or more. These monster storms have winds that can reach 480 kilometers per hour (133 meters per second; 300 meters per second).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: İnsanlar, büyütmek için binlerce yıldır lensler yapıyor ve kullanıyorlar. Ancak ilk gerçek teleskoplar 16. yüzyılın sonlarında Avrupa'da üretildi. Bu teleskoplar, uzaktaki nesnelerin hem daha yakın hem de daha büyük görünmesini sağlamak amacıyla iki mercekten oluşan bir kombinasyon kullandı.
mt: People have been making and using lenses to magnify things for thousands of years. But the first real telescopes were produced in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects both closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Muhammed, bu sıradan yaşamın ötesindeki konularla derinden ilgilenmekteydi. Düşüncülere dalmak için sık sık “Nur” (Işık) Dağı'nda bulunan ve sonradan “Hira” olarak adlandırılan bir mağaraya giderdi. O zamanlardan kalan mağaranın kendisi, Muhammed'in ruhsal eğilimine dair çok berrak bir görüntüsü sunar. Mekke'nin kuzeyindeki dağların birinin tepesinde yer alan mağara, dünyanın geri kalanından tamamen izoledir. Aslında varlığı bilinse dahi bulmak hiç kolay değildir. Mağaranın içinde tamamen bir yalıtılmışlık söz konusudur. Üzerimizdeki açık, güzel gökyüzü ve civardaki dağlar haricinde hiçbir şey görülemez. Bu dünyanın pek az bir bölümü mağaranın içinden görülebilir veya duyulabilir.
mt: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond the ordinary. He would often retreat to a cave called "Nur" (Light) or later "Hira" on the slopes of a mountain near Mecca where he could think. The cave itself is a vivid image of Muhammad's spiritual inclinations. The cave is located on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca. It is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, its existence is known, but it is not easy to find. There is a complete isolation inside the cave. The only things that can be seen or heard from the cave are the open, beautiful sky above us and the mountains around us.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Vagon yolları İngiltere'de ancak 16. yüzyılda yapılabildi. Vagon yolları sadece paralel tahta kalaslardan oluşsa da, onları çeken atların o günün biraz daha bozuk yollarına göre daha yüksek hızlara ulaşmalarına ve daha büyük yükleri çekmelerine imkan vermiştir. Traversler oldukça erken bir tarihte rayları yerinde tutmak için kullanılmaya başlamıştır. Fakat zaman içinde rayların üstlerinde demir bir şerit olduğunda daha verimli olabileceği keşfedilmiştir. Bu yaygın bir uygulama haline geldi, ancak demir vagonların ahşap tekerleklerinde daha fazla aşınmaya neden oldu. Sonuç olarak, ağaçtan yapılmış tekerleklerin yerini demir tekerlekler aldı. 1767'de, tamamen demirden yapılma ilk raylar kullanıma sokuldu.
mt: 16th century England was not ready for railroads. The rails were made of parallel wooden planks, but the horses pulling the wagons could go faster and carry more weight on the roads of the day. Traversers were used early on to keep the rails in place, but it was discovered that a strip of iron on top of the rails was more efficient. This became a common practice, but the iron wagons wore out the wooden wheels more. As a result, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first all-iron rails were put into use.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
