src: Jantların icadı, iki tekerlekli Asur arabalarını daha hafif ve daha süratli yaparken erleri ve diğer iki tekerlekli arabaları geçebilecek seviyeye getirdi. Ölümcül tatar yaylarıyla atılan oklar, düşman askerlerinin zırhını delebilirdi. Asurlular, yaklaşık MÖ 1000 yılında ilk süvarileri kullandı. Süvariler, at sırtında savaşır. Eyer henüz icat edilmemişti bu sebeple Asur süvarileri atlarının sırtında bir şey olmadan savaştı.
mt: 1. The invention of the wheel made two-wheeled Assyrian chariots lighter and faster, while passing the two-wheeled chariots of the enemy. The fatal Scythian bows could pierce the enemy's armor. The Assyrians used the first cavalry around 1000 BC. Cavalrymen fought on the backs of their horses. The stirrup had not yet been invented, so Assyrian cavalry fought without anything on their horses' backs.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Babilliler her tanrılarına, o tanrının evi sayılan bir birincil tapınak inşa etmişlerdi. İnsanlar tanrılara kurbanlar getirirdi ve rahipler törenler ve festivallerle tanrıların ihtiyaçlarını karşılamaya çalışırdı. Her tapınak açık bir tapınak avlusuna ve sonra sadece rahiplerin girebildiği bir iç ibadethaneye sahiptir. Bazen ziggurat denen özel piramit şekilli kuleler, tapınakların bir parçası olarak inşa edilirdi. Kulenin tepesi tanrı için özel bir tapınaktı.
mt: The Babylonians had built a primary temple for each of their gods, where people would bring sacrifices to the gods and priests would try to meet the gods' needs through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramidal towers called ziggurats were built as part of the temples. The top of the tower was a special temple for the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: "Evet! Kimi zaman ""Kral Tut"" kimi zaman da ""Oğlan Kral"" olarak bilinen Kral Tutankhamun, modern dünyada en çok tanınan eski Mısır krallarından biridir. İlginç bir biçimde o, antik çağlarda çok önemli görülmemiş ve çoğu antik krallar listesine alınmamıştır. Fakat 1922'de mezarının bulunması onu bilinir yaptı. Eski birçok mezar soyulurken, bu mezar neredeyse hiç bozulmadan kaldı. Tutankhamun'la birlikte gömülen eşyaların çoğu iyi korunmuştur ve bunlara değerli metallerden ve nadir taşlardan yapılan binlerce eser dahildir."
mt: "Yes! Sometimes known as ""King Tut"" and sometimes as ""Boy King"", King Tutankhamun is one of the most well-known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered very important in ancient times and was not included in most ancient king lists. However, his tomb's discovery in 1922 made him famous. Unlike many other tombs, this one was almost undisturbed. Many of the items buried with Tutankhamun were well-preserved, including thousands of items made of precious metals and rare stones."
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Birçok Yunan siyasetçi, bilim insanı ve sanatçı tanıyoruz. Bu kültürün muhtemel en ünlü kişisi Yunan edebiyatının iki başyapıtı olan İlyada ve Odysseia şiirlerinin yazarı, efsanevi kör şair Homeros'tur. Sofokles ve Aristofanes hala popüler oyun yazarlarıdır ve oyunları dünya literatürünün en büyük eserleri arasında görülmektedir. Başka bir ünlü yunan da, çoğunlukla dik üçgen kenarlarının ilişkileri hakkındaki ünlü teoremiyle bilinen matematikçi Pisagor’dur.
mt: We know many Greek politicians, scientists and artists. The most likely famous person of this culture is the blind poet Homer, the author of the two masterpieces of Greek literature, the epics Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is the mathematician Pythagoras, known for his famous theorem about the relationships of the sides of a right triangle.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: Orta Doğu'nun sıcak ikliminde ev o kadar da önemli değildi. İbrani ailesinin yaşamının çoğu açık havada geçiyordu. Kadınlar yemeği bahçede yaptılar; dükkanlar sadece sokağa bakan açık tezgahlardı. Taş, ev inşa etmek için kullanıldı. Kenan diyarında büyük ormanlar yoktu, bu sebeple odun aşırı derecede pahalıydı.
mt: In the Middle East's hot climate, a house was not so important. Most of the Hebrew family's life was spent outdoors. Women cooked in the yard; shops were just open-faced counters facing the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were not many forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was very expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: Grönland seyrek yerleşime sahiptir. İskandinav destanlarında Kızıl Erik'in cinayet sebebiyle İzlanda'dan sürüldüğü ve batıya seyahat ederken Grönland'ı bulup ona Grönland adını verdiği anlatılmaktadır. Ancak onun bu keşfine rağmen Eskimo kabileleri o sırada zaten orada yaşamaktaydı. Her ülke 'İskandinav' olsa da, Danimarka, İsveç, Norveç ve İzlanda halkları, kralları, gelenekleri ve tarihleri arasında birçok fark vardı.
mt: Greenland is sparsely populated. In the Scandinavian sagas, Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder and sailed westward, discovering Greenland and naming it after it. However, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time of his discovery. Despite this, each country is "Scandinavian" in its own way, with Denmark, Sweden, Norway, and Iceland having different kings, traditions, and histories.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Onların yediklerinin birçoğuna aşina olduğumuz halde, Romalılar, yaban domuzu, tavus kuşu, salyangoz ve fındık faresi adı verilen bir tür kemirgen gibi garip ya da alışılmadık ziyafet öğelerinden paylarını almıştır. Öteki bir farklılık ise, yoksul kişiler ve kadınlar sandalyelerde oturarak yemeklerini yerken, zengin erkeklerin yemeklerini yerken yan yatarak ziyafetler vermekten hoşlanmalarıydı. Antik Roma yemekleri, sonraki yüzyıllarda Amerika veya Asya'dan Avrupa'ya gelen yiyecekleri içermiş olamaz. Örneğin, onlarda mısır, domates, patates, kakao yoktu ve hiçbir antik Romalı hindi eti tatmamıştı.
mt: Although we are familiar with many of the foods they ate, Romans enjoyed strange or unusual feasts such as wild boar, peacock, snails and hazelnut rats. Another difference was that poor people and women ate their meals sitting on chairs, while rich men ate their meals lying on couches. Ancient Roman meals could not have included foods from America or Asia that came to Europe in later centuries. For example, they did not have corn, tomatoes, potatoes, or cocoa, and no ancient Roman had ever tasted chicken.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Medeniyet, birlikte yaşayan ve çalışan önemli ölçüde büyük bir grup insan, yani bir toplum, tarafından paylaşılan tekil bir kültürdür. Civilization' kelimesi 'civil' anlamına gelen Latince civilis kelimesinden gelir. Ayrıca, 'citizen' anlamına gelen Latince civis kelimesi ve 'city' veya 'city-state' anlamına gelen Latince civitas kelimeleri ile ilişkilidir ve bunun yanı sıra, toplumun büyüklüğünü de tanımlar. Şehir devletleri milletlerin öncüleridir. Medeniyet kültürü bilginin birkaç kuşak boyunca aktarılmasını, kalıcı bir kültürel iz ve adil bir şekilde dağılımını ifade eder. Küçük kültürler genellikle kendileri hakkında tarihi deliller bırakmadan yok olur ve gerçek uygarlıklar olarak kabul edilmez.
mt: Civilization is a shared culture of a significant number of living and working together in a large group of people, namely a society. The word civilization is derived from the Latin word civilis, which means 'civil'. It is also related to the Latin word civis, which means 'citizen' and the Latin word civitas, which means 'city' or 'city-state', and also defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. Civilization refers to the transmission of knowledge over several generations, the creation of a lasting cultural imprint and the fair distribution of it. Small cultures usually perish without leaving historical evidence and are not considered as true civilizations.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Medeniyet, birlikte yaşayan ve çalışan önemli ölçüde büyük bir grup insan, yani bir toplum, tarafından paylaşılan tekil bir kültürdür. Civilization' kelimesi 'civil' anlamına gelen Latince civilis kelimesinden gelir. Ayrıca, 'citizen' anlamına gelen Latince civis kelimesi ve 'city' veya 'city-state' anlamına gelen Latince civitas kelimeleri ile ilişkilidir ve bunun yanı sıra, toplumun büyüklüğünü de tanımlar. Şehir devletleri milletlerin öncüleridir. Medeniyet kültürü bilginin birkaç kuşak boyunca aktarılmasını, kalıcı bir kültürel iz ve adil bir şekilde dağılımını ifade eder. Küçük kültürler genellikle kendileri hakkında tarihi deliller bırakmadan yok olur ve gerçek uygarlıklar olarak kabul edilmez.
mt: Civilization is a shared culture of a significant number of living and working together in a large group of people, namely a society. The word civilization is derived from the Latin word civilis, which means 'civil'. It is also related to the Latin word civis, which means 'citizen' and the Latin word civitas, which means 'city' or 'city-state', and also defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. Civilization refers to the transmission of knowledge over several generations, the creation of a lasting cultural imprint and the fair distribution of it. Small cultures usually perish without leaving historical evidence and are not considered as true civilizations.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong, Paro Bölgesi'nin (Phondey Köyü'nde) üst kesiminde yıkık bir kale ve Budist manastırıdır. 1649'da Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel'in Tibet-Moğol kuvvetlerine karşı kazandığı zaferin anısına kaleyi yaptırdığı bahsediliyor. 1951'de, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal'ın görüntüsü gibi, Drukgyal Dzong'un yalnızca bazı kalıntılarının kalmasına neden olan bir yangın çıktı. Yangından sonra kale korunmuş ve muhafaza edilmiş, Bhutan'ın en heyecan verici görülmesi gereken yerlerinden biri olmaya devam ediyor.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined castle and Buddhist monastery in the upper Phondey village of the Paro District. It is said to have been built in 1649 by Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel to commemorate his victory over the Tibet-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire destroyed most of the Drukgyal Dzong, including a likeness of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the castle was preserved and protected, and it remains one of Bhutan's most exciting sights to see.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: 18. asırda Kamboçya kendisini iki güçlü komşu olan Tayland ve Vietnam arasında buldu. 18. yüzyılda birçok kez Kamboçya'yı işgal eden Taylandlılar 1772'de Phnom Phen'i yerle bir etmiştir. 18. yüzyılın sonlarında Vietnamlılar Kamboçya'yı da işgal etti.
mt: 18th century Cambodia found itself between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais had destroyed Phnom Penh in 1772. In the late 18th century, the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: 18. asırda Kamboçya kendisini iki güçlü komşu olan Tayland ve Vietnam arasında buldu. 18. yüzyılda birçok kez Kamboçya'yı işgal eden Taylandlılar 1772'de Phnom Phen'i yerle bir etmiştir. 18. yüzyılın sonlarında Vietnamlılar Kamboçya'yı da işgal etti.

src: Tayvan'ın dönüm noktası, 15. yüzyılda Avrupalı denizcilerin adanın ismini Ilha Formosa veya güzel ada olarak kaydettikleri bir döneme dayanır. 1624 senesinde, Dutch East India Company, güneybatı Tayvan'da bir tesis inşa ederek yerli tahıl üretimi yöntemlerinde bir değişim gerçekleştirdi ve Çinli işçileri pirinç ve şeker tarlalarında çalışmak üzere istihdam etti. 1683'te Qing hanedanı (1644-1912) güçleri Tayvan'ın batı ve kuzey kıyı bölgelerini kontrol altına aldı ve 1885'te Tayvan'ın Qing İmparatorluğu'nun bir bölgesi olduğunu açıkladı. 1895'te, Birinci Çin-Japon Savaşı'ndaki (1894-1895) yenilginin ardından Qing hükümeti Tayvan üzerindeki egemenliğini 1945'e kadar adayı yönetecek olan Japonya'ya devrettiği Shimonoseki Antlaşması'nı imzaladı.
mt: 15th century, the turning point of Taiwan, is based on the records of the island as Ilha Formosa or beautiful island by European sailors. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company, built a facility in southwestern Taiwan, and made changes in the local rice production methods, and employed Chinese workers to work in rice and sugar fields. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces took control of the western and northern coastal areas of Taiwan, and in 1885, Taiwan was declared a province of the Qing Empire. In 1895, after the defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government transferred its sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which would govern the island until 1945, by signing the Treaty of Shimonoseki.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Buna bir kimyasalın pH'ı denir. Kırmızı lahana suyu kullanarak indikatör yapabilirsiniz. Lahana suyu, içerdiği kimyasalın ne kadar asidik veya bazik (alkali) olduğuna bağlı olarak renk değiştirir. PH seviyesi, test edilen kimyasaldaki Hidrojen (pH'daki H) iyonlarının miktarı ile belirlenir. Hidrojen iyonları, elektronları kendilerinden sıyrılan protonlardır. Çünkü Hidrojen atomları bir proton ve bir elektrondan oluşur.
mt: This is called the pH of the chemical. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The juice of red cabbage changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is determined by the amount of Hydrogen (pH's H) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that have stripped electrons from themselves. Because Hydrogen atoms are made up of one proton and one electron.
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Aslanlar en sosyal kedilerdir. Sürü denilen büyük gruplarda yaşarlar. Aslan sürüleri otuz civarında dişi ve yavruyla birlikte bir ila üç arasında değişen yetişkin akraba erkekten oluşur. Dişiler genellikle birbiriyle yakın akrabadır ve büyük bir kız kardeşler ve kızlar ailesinin parçasıdırlar. Aslan sürüleri, davranış olarak şaşırtıcı bir şekilde aslanlara (fakat diğer büyük kedilere değil) benzeyen hayvanlar olan kurt veya köpek sürülerine çok benzer hareket eder ve ayrıca avlarına karşı çok ölümcüldürler.
mt: Lions are the most social of cats. They live in groups called prides. A pride consists of about thirty females and their cubs, and one to three related adult males. Females are usually closely related and are part of a big sister and daughters family. Lion prides, in their behavior, are very similar to prides of wolves or dogs, and are also very deadly to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Bunların alt katmanında, tavşanlardan antiloplara ve geyiklere kadar ortalama ebatlardaki avları yiyen daha orta ölçülerde kediler vardır. Son olarak, böcekler, kemirgenler, kertenkeleler ve kuşlar gibi birçok küçük avı yiyen birçok küçük kedi (serbest bırakılan evcil kediler dahil) vardır. Başarılarının sırrı, her bir kedinin sahip olduğu ve başkalarıyla rekabet etmelerini engelleyen özel bir iş olan niş kavramıdır.
mt: 1. At the bottom, there are medium-sized cats that eat average-sized prey such as rabbits, antelopes, and deer. 2. There are many small cats (including free-roaming domestic cats) that eat many small prey such as insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret of their success is the concept of niche, which is a unique job that each cat has and prevents them from competing with each other.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Ocelotlar küçük hayvanları yemeye bayılır. Maymunları, yılanları, kemirgenleri ve becerebilirlerse kuşları yakalarlar. Ocelotun avladığı hayvanların tamamına yakını kendisinden çok daha küçük bedene sahiptir. Bilim insanları, ocelotların, diğer hayvanları yerin neresinde olduklarını sezerek, koklayarak yemek (avlamak) için takip ettiklerini ve bulduklarını düşünüyor. Gece görüşü ile birlikte geceleri çok iyi görebilirler ve aynı zamanda son derece gizlice hareket edebilirler. Oselolar, avlarının ortamı ile bütünleşerek onları yakalarlar.
mt: Ocelots love to eat small animals. They eat monkeys, snakes, rodents and if they can catch them, birds. All of the animals that an ocelot eats are much smaller than its own body. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find their food by smelling where the animals are and by smelling the ground. They can see very well at night because they have night vision and they can move very quietly. Ocelots catch their prey by blending in with the environment.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Çok yönlü bir atlet olan kaplan tırmanabilir (iyi olmasa da), yüzebilir, büyük mesafeler atlayabilir ve güçlü bir insanın beş katı kuvvetle çekebilir. Kaplanlar; aslanlar, leoparlar ve jaguarlarla aynı gruptadır (Genus Panthera). Bu dört kedi, kükreyebilen yegane kedi türleridir. Kaplanın kükremesi bir aslanın tam sesli kükremesi gibi değil, çok daha hırıltılı, bağıran sözlerle kurulan bir cümleyi andırıyor.
mt: The leopard is a versatile athlete, able to climb trees (though not well), swim, leap great distances, and pull five times the strength of a man. Leopards are in the same group as lions, leopards, and jaguars (Genus Panthera). These four cats are the only cats that roar. A leopard's roar is not like a lion's full-throated roar, but rather a raspy, barking phrase.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Hücre, bir canlı (varlık) organizmanın en küçük yapısal ve işlevsel birimidir. Cell kelimesi Latincede küçük oda anlamına gelen cella'dan gelir. Canlı varlıklara mikroskop ile baktığınızda küçük kare veya toplardan meydana geldiklerini görürsünüz. İngiltere'den bir biyolog olan Robert Hooke, bir mikroskopla tıpada küçük kareler görmüştür. Hücreler, odalar gibi gözüküyordu. Hooke, ölü hücreleri gözlemleyen ilk kişiydi.
mt: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of an organism. The word cell comes from the Latin cella, meaning "small room". When viewed through a microscope, cells appear as small compartments. In England, a biologist named Robert Hooke observed small rooms through a microscope. Cells looked like rooms. Hooke was the first person to observe dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Hücre, bir canlı (varlık) organizmanın en küçük yapısal ve işlevsel birimidir. Cell kelimesi Latincede küçük oda anlamına gelen cella'dan gelir. Canlı varlıklara mikroskop ile baktığınızda küçük kare veya toplardan meydana geldiklerini görürsünüz. İngiltere'den bir biyolog olan Robert Hooke, bir mikroskopla tıpada küçük kareler görmüştür. Hücreler, odalar gibi gözüküyordu. Hooke, ölü hücreleri gözlemleyen ilk kişiydi.
mt: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of an organism. The word cell comes from the Latin cella, meaning "small room". When viewed through a microscope, cells appear as small compartments. In England, a biologist named Robert Hooke observed small rooms through a microscope. Cells looked like rooms. Hooke was the first person to observe dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Hayvanlar pek çok hücreden oluşur. Bir şeyler yerler ve içeride sindirim gerçekleşir. Hayvanların büyük kısmı hareket edebilir. Sadece hayvanlarda beyin bulunur (tüm hayvanlarda bulunmasa da; mesela denizanasının beyni yoktur). Hayvanlar dünyanın bütün yerlerinde mevcuttur. Toprakları kazır, okyanusta yüzer ve göklerde uçarlar.
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. They eat and digest things inside them. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (even though not all animals have brains; for example, sea anemones don't have brains). Animals are found all over the world. They dig in the ground, swim in the ocean, and fly in the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Bitkiler insanların soluduğu oksijeni üretir ve insanların çıkardığı (yani soluk verdiği) karbondioksiti alır. Bitkiler besinlerini güneşten fotosentezle elde ederler. Gölge de sağlarlar. Evlerimizi bitkilerden yapıyoruz ve kıyafetlerimizi bitkilerden yapıyoruz. Yediğimiz yiyeceklerin çoğu bitkidir. Bitkiler olmadan hayvanlar hayatta kalamazdı.
mt: Plants produce the oxygen we breathe and take in the carbon dioxide we exhale. They get their food from the sun through photosynthesis. They provide shade. We build our houses with plants and our clothes with plants. Most of the food we eat is plant-based. Animals could not survive without plants.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Küçük bir canlı grubu (küçük bir popülasyon), geldikleri popülasyondan ayrıldığında (örneğin bir sıradağın ya da nehrin ardına giderlerse ya da geri dönmelerinin kolay olmayacağı yeni bir adaya giderlerse) genellikle kendilerini önceki çevrelerinden farklı bir çevrede bulacaklardır. Bu yeni ortam farklı kaynaklara ve farklı rakiplere sahiptir, yani yeni nüfus, daha önce ihtiyaç duymuş olduklarından daha güçlü bir rakip olmak için farklı özelliklere ya da adaptasyonlara ihtiyaç duyacaktır. Orijinal popülasyon hiç değişmedi. Hala öncekiyle aynı adaptasyonlara ihtiyaçları var. Zamanla, yeni nüfus yeni çevresine uyum sağlamaya başladıkça diğer popülasyondan gittikçe daha farklı görünmeye başlarlar. Eninde sonunda, binlerce hatta milyonlarca yıl sonra, bu iki hayvan aynı tür denemeyecek kadar farklı gözükecektir. Bu sürece yeni türlerin oluşumu anlamına gelen türleşme diyoruz. Türleşme, kaçınılmaz bir sonuç ve evrimin çok önemli bir parçasıdır.
mt: A small group (population), when they separate from their original population (for example, when they go to a new mountain or river or to a new island where it is difficult to return), will usually find themselves in a new environment different from their original one. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different traits or adaptations to become a stronger competitor than they did before. The original population has not changed. It still needs the same adaptations. Over time, the new population begins to adapt to its new environment, and it starts to look more and more different from the original population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, these two animals will look so different that they will not be considered the same species. This process is called speciation. Speciation is inevitable and is an important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Kan pompalayan kalp, dolaşım sistemindeki temel organdır. Kan, arter adı verilen tüplerde kalpten çıkar ve damar adı verilen tüplerde kalbe geri döner. En küçük tüplere kılcal damar adı verilir.
mt: The heart is the main organ of the circulatory system. Blood is pumped out of the heart through arteries and back into the heart through veins. The smallest vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Uçmayı başaran ilk hayvanlar böceklerdi. Uçma kabiliyetleri, düşmanlardan daha kolay kurtulmalarına, yiyecekleri ve eşlerini daha kolay bir şekilde az çaba harcayarak bulmalarına yardımcı oldu. Çoğu böcek, kanatlarını vücutları boyunca geriye doğru katlayabilme avantajına sahiptir. Bu, onlara avcılardan saklanacak daha geniş ve küçük bir yer yelpazesi sağlar. Günümüzde, kanatlarını geriye doğru katlayamayan böcek türleri yalnızca yusufçuklar ve mayıs sinekleridir.
mt: The first animals to fly were insects. Their ability to fly helped them escape predators, find food and mates more easily with less effort. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings backward along their bodies. This gives them a wider and smaller range of places to hide from predators. Today, the only insect species that cannot fold their wings backward are dragonflies and midges.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Bugün paleontologların büyük kısmı, bir grup dinozorun hayatta kaldığına ve bugün yaşadığına inanıyor. Biz onları kuş olarak adlandırıyoruz. İnsanların büyük bir kısmı, tüylerinin bulunması ve uçabilmeleri nedeniyle, onları dinozor olarak görmez. Fakat kuşlar hakkında hâlâ dinozor gibi görünen pek çok şey vardır. Pullu ayakları ve pençeleri var, yumurtluyorlar ve bir T-Rex gibi iki arka ayakları üzerinde yürüyorlar.
mt: Today, most paleontologists believe that a group of dinosaurs survived and are still living. We call them birds. Most people think of them as dinosaurs because of their feathers and ability to fly. But there are still many things about birds that look like dinosaurs. They have clawed feet and lay eggs, and they walk on two hind legs like a T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Bir triceratops dinozorunun dişleri yalnızca yaprakları değil, çok diri dalları ve hatta kökleri bile parçalayabilirdi. Bazı bilim insanları Triceratopsun, Kretase döneminde yaygın olan bir bitki türü olan sikas ile beslendiğini düşünmektedir. Bu bitkiler, keskin, dikenli yapraklardan oluşan taçlarıyla küçük bir palmiye ağacına benzer. Bir Triceratops, gövdeyi yemeden önce yaprakları soymak için güçlü gagasını kullanabilirdi. Diğer bilim adamları bu bitkilerin çok zehirli olduğunu savunuyorlar. Bu nedenle bugün tembel hayvan ve dinozorların soyundan gelen papağan gibi diğer hayvanlar zehirli yaprakları veya meyveleri yiyebilse de herhangi bir dinozorun onları yemesi mümkün değildir.
mt: A triceratops dinosaur's teeth could have shredded not only leaves, but also very tough branches and even roots. Some scientists think that the Triceratops ate a common plant species of the Cretaceous period called sassafras. These plants are similar to a small palm tree with spiny leaves. A Triceratops could have used its powerful beak to strip the leaves before eating the stem. Other scientists argue that these plants were very poisonous. Therefore, today's slothful animals and dinosaurs' descendants such as parrots can eat poisonous leaves or fruits, but no dinosaur could have eaten them.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: İtalya'nın milli futbol takımı, Alman milli futbol takımıyla birlikte dünyadaki en başarılı ikinci takımdır ve 2006'da FIFA Dünya Kupası şampiyonu olmuştur. Futbol, ​​basketbol, ​​voleybol, sutopu, eskrim, ragbi, bisiklete binme, buz hokeyi, patenli hokey ve F1 motorlu araç yarışları popüler sporlardandır. Kış sporları en çok Kuzey bölgelerinde popülerdir ve İtalyanlar uluslararası oyunlarda ve Olimpik etkinliklerde yarışırlar.
mt: Italy's national football team is the second most successful team in the world, and won the FIFA World Cup in 2006. Football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, speed skating and Formula 1 motor racing are popular sports. Winter sports are most popular in the northern regions and Italians compete in international games and Olympic events.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Lüksemburg uzun bir geçmişe sahiptir ancak bağımsızlığı 1839'da başlamıştır. Belçika'nın günümüzdeki bölgeleri geçmişte Lüksemburg'un bir parçasıydı ancak 1830'lar Belçika Devrimi'nden sonra Belçikalı oldu. Lüksemburg daima tarafsız bir ülke halinde kalmayı denedi ancak hem 1. Dünya Savaşı hem de 2. Dünya Savaşı’nda Almanya tarafından işgal edildi. 1957'de Lüksemburg, bugün Avrupa Birliği olarak bilinen organizasyonun kurucu üyesi oldu.
mt: 1839 is when Luxembourg gained independence, but it has a long history. The current regions of Belgium were once part of Luxembourg, but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain neutral, but was occupied by Germany during both World Wars. In 1957, Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is now known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Türkiye'nin Avrupa kısmı (Balkan yarımadasındaki Doğu Trakya veya Rumeli) ülkenin %3'ünü kapsamaktadır. Kabaca dikdörtgen biçiminde olan Türkiye toprakları 1.600 kilometre uzunluğunda ve 800 kilometre genişliğindedir. Göller de dahil olmak üzere Türkiye'nin yüzölçümü 783.562 kilometrekare (300.948 mil kare), bunun 755.688 kilometrekaresi (291.773 metrekare) güneybatı Asya'da ve 23.764 kilometre karesi (9.174 mil kare) Avrupa'da bulunmaktadır. Fransa'nın Avrupa'daki topraklarının ve Birleşik Krallık'ın toplam yüzölçümü ile yaklaşık aynı olan Türkiye'nin yüzölçümü, onu dünyanın 37. en büyük ülkesi yapar. Türkiye'nin üç tarafı denizlerle çevrilidir: Batıda Ege Denizi, kuzeyde Karadeniz ve güneyde Akdeniz.
mt: 3% of Turkey's land is in Europe (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula). Roughly rectangular in shape, Turkey's land is 1,600 kilometres (990 mi) long and 800 kilometres (500 mi) wide. Including lakes, Turkey's area is 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) is in south-western Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area is approximately the same as that of France's European territory and the United Kingdom's total area, making Turkey the 37th largest country in the world. Three sides of Turkey are surrounded by sea: the west by the Aegean Sea, the north by the Black Sea and the south by the Mediterranean Sea.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Vatikan'ın nüfusu 800 civarındadır. O, dünyadaki en küçük bağımsız ülkedir ve en az nüfusa sahip ülke. Vatikan, mevzuatında ve resmi iletişimlerinde İtalyancayı kullanır. İtalyanca, eyalette çalışanların çoğu tarafından konuşulan günlük dildir, Latince ise genellikle dini törenlerde kullanılır. Vatikan Şehri'nin tüm vatandaşları Katoliktir.
mt: 800 is the population of the Vatican. It is the smallest independent country in the world and has the lowest population. The Vatican uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is the daily language spoken by most of the workers in the city, while Latin is used mainly in religious ceremonies. All citizens of the Vatican City are Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Günümüzde bilgisayarlar, resimleri ve videoları değiştirmek için kullanılır. Bilgisayarlarda oluşturulabilen karmaşık animasyonlar, televizyonda ve filmlerde giderek daha çok kullanılmaktadır. Müzik, sesleri birlikte işlemek ve mikslemek için genellikle gelişmiş bilgisayarlar kullanılarak kaydedilir.
mt: Today computers are used to alter photographs and videos. Complex animations created on computers are increasingly used in television and movies. Music is usually recorded using advanced computers to mix and process sounds together.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Harappa ve Mohenjo-daro şehirlerinin hemen hemen her evi sofistike bir kanalizasyon sistemine bağlı bir sifonlu tuvalete sahipti. Yunanistan'da Girit ve Santorini Adasında bulunan Minos kentlerinin evlerinde kanalizasyon sistemi kalıntıları bulundu. Eski Mısır, İran ve Çin'de de tuvaletler vardı. Roma medeniyetinde tuvaletler bazen kadın ve erkeklerin karma bir şirkette bir arada olduğu hamamların bir parçasıydı.
mt: Almost every house in the cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a sophisticated sewer system connected to a siphon toilet. Sewer systems were also found in the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. Toilets were also present in ancient Egypt, Iran and China. In the Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of a mixed-sex bathhouse.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Modern buz pateni üstündeki bıçağın, aralarında içbükey bir oyuk bulunan iki kenarı vardır. İki kenar, eğik olduğunda bile buzun daha iyi kavranmasına imkan verir. Kızağın tabanı hafifçe kavisli olduğu için, kızak bir tarafa ya da diğerine eğildiğinde buzla temas eden kenar da kavis alır. Bu, patencinin dönmesine neden olur. Eğer patenler sağ eğilirse patenci sağa, patenler sola eğilirse patenci sola döner.
mt: The blade of a modern ice skate has two edges, one of which has a concave groove in it. The edges, even when tilted, allow better contact with the ice. The blade's bottom is slightly curved so that when the skates are tilted to one side or the other, the edge also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates are tilted to the right, the skater turns to the right, and if the skates are tilted to the left, the skater turns to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "Önceki enerji seviyelerine geri dönmek için ışıktan aldıkları ekstra enerjiden kurtulmaları gerekir. Bunu ""foton"" adı verilen çok küçük ışık partiküllerini emerek yaparlar. Bilim insanları bu süreci ""uyarılmış radyasyon emisyonu"" olarak adlandırırlar, çünkü parlak ışık atomları uyarır ve bir ışık fotonunun emisyonuna neden olur. Işık da bir tür radyasyondur. Bir sonraki resim, foton yayan atomları göstermektedir. Tabii ki aslında fotonlar resimdekilerden çok daha küçüktür. Fotonlar, atomları oluşturan maddelerden bile daha küçüktür!"
mt: "They have to get rid of the extra energy they get from light. They do this by absorbing photons, the very small light particles. Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"", because bright light excites atoms and causes emission of a photon. Light is also a type of radiation. The next picture shows atoms emitting photons. Of course, photons are much smaller than the ones in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the atoms that make up matter!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Yüzlerce saatlik işleyişin ardından ampülün içindeki filamen nihayetinde yanar ve ampül artık çalışmaz. Bu durumda ampulün değiştirilmesi gerekmektedir. Ampulü değiştirirken dikkatli olmak gerekir. Öncelikle aydınlatma armatürünün anahtarı kapatılmalı ya da kablo bağlantısı kesilmelidir. Bunun nedeni ampulün metal kısmının oturduğu sokete akan elektriğin kısmen soketteyken soketin iç kısmına veya ampulün metal tabanına dokunursanız sizi çarpabilmesidir.
mt: After hours of operation, the filament inside the bulb eventually burns and the bulb no longer works. In this case, the bulb must be replaced. When replacing the bulb, be careful. First, the lighting fixture's switch should be turned off or the cable connection should be cut. The reason for this is that the electricity flowing into the socket can partially flow into the socket's interior or the metal base of the bulb when you touch the socket's metal part or the bulb's metal base.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Fisyon bombası, birçok proton ve nötrona sahip bir atom çekirdeğini bir araya getirmek için enerji alması ilkesine göre çalışır. Bu süreç bir anlamda, bir el arabasını tepeye çıkarmak gibidir. Çekirdeği tekrar yarar ve sonra o enerjinin bir kısmını serbest bırakır. Bazı atomların kararsız çekirdekleri vardır, yani küçük bir müdahaleyle ya da hiç müdahale olmadan parçalanabilirler.
mt: Fusion bombs work on the principle of fusing together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons, which means taking energy from the system. It's like pushing a shopping cart up a hill. The nucleus then becomes useful and then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei, meaning they can fission with a small or no intervention.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Binlerce kilometre uzağınızda yaşayan birisini aradığınız zaman bir uyduyu araç olarak kullanmış oluyorsunuz. Uzaydaki uydu, çağrıyı alır ve neredeyse anlık bir şekilde geri yansıtır. Uydu uzaya bir roketle gönderilmektedir. Dünya atmosferi ışığımızın ve görüşümüzün bir kısmını kırdığı için bilim insanları teleskopları uzayda kullanmaktadır. Uzaya bir uydu veya teleskop koymak için 30 metre boyundan daha uzun devasa bir rokete ihtiyaç vardır.
mt: When you are looking for someone who lives thousands of kilometres away, you are using a satellite as a vehicle. The satellite in space receives the call and reflects it back almost instantaneously. The satellite is sent into space by a rocket. The Earth's atmosphere has destroyed a part of our light and our vision so scientists use telescopes in space. To put a satellite or a telescope in space, you need a gigantic rocket that is longer than 30 metres.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Zaman, hep hayatımızda olan ve yaptığımız her şeyi etkileyen, ancak yine de anlaması zor olan bir şeydir. Zaman binlerce yıldır, din, felsefe ve bilim alimleri tarafından çalışılmıştır. Zamanı, bugün üzerinden, gelecekten geçmişe, uzanan olaylar serisi olarak deneyimliyoruz. Zaman ayrıca olayların süresini (uzunluğunu) nasıl kıyasladığımızdır. Döngüsel bir olayın tekrarını gözlemleyerek zamanın geçişini kendiniz işaretleyebilirsiniz. Döngüsel bir olay, düzenli olarak tekrar tekrar gerçekleşen bir şeydir.
mt: Time is something that has always been with us and affects everything we do, but still is hard to understand. Time has been studied by religion, philosophy and science for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events, from the past to the present and into the future. Time is also how we compare the lengths of events. You can mark the passage of time by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens over and over again in a regular way.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Zaman, hep hayatımızda olan ve yaptığımız her şeyi etkileyen, ancak yine de anlaması zor olan bir şeydir. Zaman binlerce yıldır, din, felsefe ve bilim alimleri tarafından çalışılmıştır. src: Geleneksel olarak tahtın varisi, eğitimini bitirdikten sonra doğrudan askere giderdi. Buna rağmen Charles; Antropoloji, Arkeoloji ve sonrasında Tarih okuduğu, Cambridge'de bulunan Trinity College'a gitti ve 2:2 (2. sınıfta ikincilik) derecesi kazandı. Charles, Britanya Kraliyet Ailesi'nin üniversite lisans derecesi alan ilk üyesiydi.
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing his education. However, Charles; Anthropology, Archaeology and then History studied at Trinity College, Cambridge and got a 2:2 (second class lower division) degree. Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to receive a university bachelor's degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

Charles, Britanya Kraliyet Ailesi'nin üniversite lisans derecesi alan ilk üyesiydi.
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing his education. However, Charles; Anthropology, Archaeology and then History studied at Trinity College, Cambridge and got a 2:2 (second class lower division) degree. Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to receive a university bachelor's degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: İngiltere, Danelaw'un yeniden fethinden sonra uzun bir barış dönemi yaşamıştır. Ancak 991 yılında Ethelred, Guthrum'dan bir asır önce karşılaştıklarından daha büyük bir Viking filosuyla karşı karşıya kaldı. Bu filo, ülkesini Danimarka egemenliğinden geri alma hırsıyla dolu bir Norveçli olan Olaf Trygvasson tarafından yönetiliyordu. Başlangıçtaki askeri aksiliklerden sonra, Ethelred, krallığını kazanmayı denemek için karışık başarılarla Norveç'e geri dönen Olaf'la masaya oturabilecek duruma gelmişti.
mt: 991, after the re-conquest of Danelaw, England had enjoyed a long period of peace. However, Ethelred was faced with a larger Viking fleet than he had encountered a century earlier from Guthrum. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian full of ambition to regain his country from Danish rule. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was in a position to negotiate with Olaf, who had returned to Norway with mixed success in his attempts to regain his kingdom.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "15. yüzyıl civarında, kuzey Estonya, Almanya'nın yoğun kültürel etkisi altındaydı. Bazı Alman keşişleri Tanrı'yı yerli halka daha da yakınlaştırmak istedi ve Estonya edebi dilini icat ettiler. Alman alfabesini temel alıyordu ve bir ""Õ/õ"" karakteri eklendi. Zaman geçtikçe, Almancadan ödünç alınan birçok kelime kaynaştı. Bu aydınlanmanın başıydı."
mt: 15th century, northern Estonia was under the intense cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the local people and invented the Estonian literary language. It was based on the German alphabet and an "Õ/õ" character was added. Over time, many words borrowed from German were assimilated. This was the beginning of enlightenment.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Kaç kişinin Hintçe konuştuğuna dair çeşitli tahminler vardır. Dünyada en çok konuşulan ikinci ve dördüncü dil arasında olduğu tahmin edilmektedir. Ana dilde konuşanların sayısı, çok yakından ilişkili lehçelerin sayılıp sayılmayacağına bağlıdır. Tahminlere göre 340 milyon ila 500 milyon kişi konuşuyor ve 800 milyon kişi dili anlayabiliyor. Hintçe ve Urduca kelime haznesi yönünden oldukça benzer ancak yazı bakımından farklıdır. Günlük konuşmalarda, her iki dilin konuşanları genellikle birbirlerini anlayabilir.
mt: 340 million to 500 million people speak it as a first language, and 800 million people understand it. Hindi and Urdu have a similar vocabulary but different writing systems. Speakers of both languages usually understand each other in everyday speech.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: "Hangeul, popüler günlük kullanım için tasarlanarak icat edilmiş tek alfabedir. Alfabe, Kral Sejong'un (1418 – 1450) hüküm sürdüğü dönemde 1444 yılında icat edildi. Kral Sejong, Joseon Krallığı'nın dördüncü kralıydı ve en çok saygı görenlerden biridir. Aslında Hangeul alfabesine ""halkın talimatı için doğru sesler"" anlamına gelen Hunmin Jeongeum ismini vermişti."
mt: "Hangeul was invented for popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Kingdom and is one of the most respected. He actually named the Hangeul alphabet "the right sounds for the people's instruction" in Hunmin Jeongeum."
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Sanskritçe'nin ortaya çıkış şekline dair pek çok fikir bulunmaktadır. Bu fikirlerden biri, Aryanların Batı'dan Hindistan'a göç ederek dillerini de coğrafyaya taşımasıdır. Sanskritçe eski bir dildir ve Avrupa'da konuşulan Latin diliyle kıyaslanabilir. Dünyanın bilinen en eski kitabı Sanskritçe dilinde yazılmıştır. Sanskritçe Upanişad'ların derlenmesinden sonra hiyerarşiden dolayı zaman içinde yok olmuştur. Latince'nin Fransızca ve İspanyolca gibi Avrupa dillerinin kaynağı olması gibi Sanskritçe de pek çok modern Hint dilinin kaynağı olan çok karmaşık ve zengin bir dildir.
mt: 1. There are many theories about the origin of Sanskrit. One of them is that the Aryans migrated from the West to India and took their languages with them. Sanskrit is an old language and can be compared to Latin. The oldest known book is written in Sanskrit. Sanskrit was lost after the compilation of the Upanishads due to its hierarchy. Like Latin, Sanskrit is the source of many modern Indian languages, which are complex and rich.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Io'nun yerçekimi beni nasıl çeker? Io'nun yüzeyinde durursanız Dünya'da olduğunuzdan daha hafif çekersiniz. Dünya üzerinde 200 pound (90 kg) gelen bir kişi, Io'da yaklaşık 36 pound (16kg) gelir. Yani yerçekimi elbette sizi daha az çeker.
mt: 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth, 36 pounds (16 kg) on Io. Gravity does pull you less.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Ay'ın yüzeyi kayalardan ve tozdan oluşur. Ay'ın dış katmanına kabuk ismi verilir. Yerkabuğu yakın tarafta yaklaşık 70 km, uzak tarafta ise 100 km kalınlığındadır. Maria'nın altında daha ince, dağlık bölgelerde daha kalındır. Kabuk daha ince olduğundan yan tarafta daha çok maria olabilir. Lav için yer yüzüne çıkmak daha kolaydı.
mt: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The Earth's crust is about 70 km thick in the near side and 100 km thick in the far side. The crust is thinner under Maria and is more mountainous in the regions where it is thicker. It is easier for lava to come to the surface of the Moon.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: "Birçok insan, insanların başka bir yıldıza seyahat edip başka dünyaları keşfedebilecekleri günü hayal ediyor, bazı insanlar orada ne olduğunu merak ediyor, bazıları uzaylıların veya diğer yaşamların başka bir gezegende varolabileceğine inanıyor. Fakat bu gerçekleşse bile muhtemelen çok uzun süre beklememiz gerekecek. Yıldızlar birbirinden o kadar uzak ki ""komşu"" olarak adlandırılan yıldızlar arasında trilyonlarca kilometre vardır. Belki bir gün torunlarınızın torunları yabancı bir gezegende durup eski atalarını merak ederler?"
mt: "Many people dream of the day when people will travel to another star and explore other worlds, some wonder what is out there, some believe that aliens or other life forms may exist on another planet. But if this happens, it will probably be a long time coming. The stars are so far apart that the ""neighbors"" between the stars are trillions of kilometers apart. Maybe one day your grandchildren's grandchildren will stand on a foreign planet and wonder about their ancestors?"
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: "Güneşte, Dünya gibi üzerinde ayakta durabileceğiniz bir kabuk yoktur. Güneşin tamamı gaz, ateş ve plazmadan meydana gelir. Güneşin merkezinden uzaklaştıkça gazın yoğunluğu incelmektedir. Güneşe baktığımızda gördüğümüz dış kısma fotosfer denir, ""ışık topu"" anlamına gelir."
mt: "On the sun, there is no crust on which you can stand like on Earth. The entire sun is made of gas, fire and plasma. As you move away from the center of the sun, the density of the gas decreases. The outer part of the sun that we see is called the photosphere, meaning "light ball"."
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: "Güneşte, Dünya gibi üzerinde ayakta durabileceğiniz bir kabuk yoktur. Güneşin tamamı gaz, ateş ve plazmadan meydana gelir. Güneşin merkezinden uzaklaştıkça gazın yoğunluğu incelmektedir. Güneşe baktığımızda gördüğümüz dış kısma fotosfer denir, ""ışık topu"" anlamına gelir."

The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Yaklaşık üç bin senenin ardından, 1610 yılında İtalyan astronom Galileo Galilei, tıpkı ay gibi Venüs'ün fazları olduğu gözlemini yapmak amacıyla bir teleskop kullandı. Evreler, Venüs'ün (veya Ay'ın) sadece Güneş'e bakan tarafı aydınlandığı için gerçekleşir. Venüs'ün evreleri, Kopernik'in, gezegenlerin Güneş'in etrafında döndüğüne dair teorisini desteklemiştir. Birkaç yıl sonra 1639'da, Jeremiah Horrocks adlı bir İngiliz astronom, Venüs'ün geçişini gözlemledi.
mt: 1610 yılında İtalyan astronom Galileo Galilei, tıpkı ay gibi Venüs'ün fazları olduğu gözlemini yapmak amacıyla bir teleskop kullandı. Evreler, Venüs'ün (veya Ay'ın) sadece Güneş'e bakan tarafı aydınlandığı için gerçekleşir. Venüs'ün evreleri, Kopernik'in, gezegenlerin Güneş'in etrafında döndüğüne dair teorisini desteklemiştir. Birkaç yıl sonra 1639'da, Jeremiah Horrocks adlı bir İngiliz astronom, Venüs'ün geçişini gözlemledi.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Amazon Nehri yeryüzündeki en uzun ikinci ve en büyük nehirdir. En büyük ikinci nehrin 8 mislinden daha fazla su taşımaktadır. Amazon, altı mile varan genişliğiyle, aynı zamanda dünya üzerindeki en geniş nehirdir. Gezegenin nehirlerinden okyanuslara dökülen suyun tam yüzde 20'si Amazon'dan geliyor. Amazon Nehri'nin ana kolu 6,387 km'dir (3,980 mil). Binlerce küçük nehirden su toplar.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest river in the world and the largest by volume of water. It carries eight times as much water as the second largest river, the Congo in Africa. The Amazon is also the widest river in the world, with a width of six miles. Twenty percent of the world's fresh water flows into the ocean from the Amazon. The main stem of the Amazon is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of small rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Venezuelalıların yüzde on sekizi işsizdir ve çalışanların çoğu kayıt dışı ekonomide istihdam edilmektedir. Çalışan Venezuellalıların üçte ikisi hizmet sektöründe, neredeyse dörtte biri sanayide ve beşte biri tarımda çalışıyor. Petrol, Venezuelalılar için önemli bir sektör ve nüfusun yalnızca yüzde biri bu sektörde çalışmasına rağmen ülke kesinlikle bir petrol ihracatçısıdır.
mt: 10% of Venezuelans are unemployed and most of the employed are in the informal economy. Two-thirds of working Venezuelans are in the service sector, nearly a third in industry and a fifth in agriculture. Oil is an important sector for Venezuelans, even though only 1% of the population works in the sector, the country is definitely an oil exporter.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

Two-thirds of working Venezuelans are in the service sector, nearly a third in industry and a fifth in agriculture. Oil is an important sector for Venezuelans, even though only 1% of the population works in the sector, the country is definitely an oil exporter.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Yıldızların ışık ve ısı vermesinin nedeni hidrojen atomlarının daha ağır elementler meydana getirmek için birleşmesiyle (veya kaynaşmasıyla) oluşan enerjidir. Bilim insanları aynı şekilde enerji üretebilen bir reaktör oluşturmak için çalışıyorlar. Ancak bu çözülmesi çok zor bir sorundur ve yararlı füzyon reaktörlerinin inşa edildiğini görmemiz yıllar alacaktır.
mt: The energy that stars emit in the form of light and heat is the result of hydrogen atoms fusing together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that produces energy in the same way. However, this is a very difficult problem to solve and we will not see useful fusion reactors built for years to come.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Elementler ve bileşenler bir halden diğerine geçebilir ve değişmeyebilir. Nitrojen gaz olarak hala sıvı nitrojenle aynı özelliklere sahiptir. Sıvı hali daha yoğundur ama moleküller hala aynıdır. Su başka bir örnektir. Bileşik su, iki hidrojen atomu ve bir oksijen atomundan oluşur. Gaz, sıvı veya katı halde olup olmamasına bakılmaksızın birebir aynı moleküler yapıya sahiptir. Fiziksel durumu değişse de, kimyasal durumu aynı kalır.
mt: Elements and compounds can change states and remain unchanged. Nitrogen gas is still liquid nitrogen with the same properties. The liquid form is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. Compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. Regardless of whether it is in a gaseous, liquid, or solid state, it has the same molecular structure. Its physical state may change but its chemical state remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Amerikan Bağımsızlık Savaşı sırasında on üç koloni, Konfederasyon Anayasası altında ilk olarak zayıf bir merkezi hükümet kurdu ve Kongre, bu hükumetin tek bileşeniydi. Kongrenin vergilendirme yetkisi yoktu ve ulusal düzeyde yürütme veya yargı olmadığı için, tüm fiillerini uygulamaya sokmak için sıklıkla işbirliğine yanaşmayan devlet yetkililerine güveniyordu. Vergi kanunlarını ve eyaletler arası tariflere geçersiz kılma yetkisi de yoktu. Maddelerin değiştirilebilmesi için tüm eyaletlerin oybirliğiyle rızasına gerek duyuluyordu ve eyaletler merkezi hükümeti o kadar hafife alıyorlardı ki temsilcileri genellikle görev başında değillerdi.
mt: 13 colonies during the American Revolutionary War first established a weak central government under the Articles of Confederation, and the Congress was the only component of this government. Congress had no power to tax and had no executive or judiciary at the national level, so it often relied on the goodwill of state officials who were reluctant to cooperate in implementing its measures. It also had no power to enact tax laws or to invalidate interstate tariffs. Amendments could only be made with the unanimous consent of all states, and states were so dismissive of the central government that their representatives were often absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
